units.title: Split organoids into three culture conditions at day 35
units.text: At day 35, organoids from each line were split into three different conditions: 1) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above (with vitamin A); 2) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond (with vitamin A) plus 100 μM DEAB, an inhibitor of RA synthesis; or 3) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above without vitamin A.
units.rationale: Defines the experimental groups for downstream analyses.

units.title: Digest tissue with papain and DNase to obtain single‑cell suspension
units.text: We used 1323-4 in Papain containing DNase I (DNase) for 30 min at 37 °C and samples were triturated to form a single-cell suspension.
units.rationale: Creates a single‑cell suspension required for downstream single‑cell assays.

units.title: Lyse cells in chilled lysis buffer
units.text: Cells (106) were pelleted and lysed for 3 min in 100 μl chilled lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 0.1% Igepal CA-630, 0.01% digitonin, 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA)).
units.rationale: Releases nuclei while preserving chromatin integrity.

units.title: Wash lysed cells and pellet nuclei
units.text: Lysed cells were then washed with 1 ml chilled wash buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 1% BSA) and nuclei were pelleted at 500g for 5 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Removes lysis reagents and concentrates nuclei for library preparation.

units.title: Generate single‑cell RNA‑seq libraries with 10X Chromium
units.text: Single-cell RNA-seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample.
units.rationale: Enables high‑throughput transcriptional profiling of individual cells.

units.title: Prepare bulk ATAC‑seq libraries from nuclei
units.text: Bulk ATAC-seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeabilized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Produces genome‑wide chromatin accessibility data from bulk tissue.

units.title: Perform H3K27ac CUT&Tag on dissociated cells
units.text: H3K27ac CUT&Tag libraries were prepared as previously described60, with modifications. In brief, cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in neural induction medium at a density of 10,000 cells per well in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig-wash buffer before resuspension in 100 μl dig-wash buffer supplemented with 2 mM EDTA and a 1:50 dilution of H3K27ac primary antibody (Cell Signaling 8173), and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary orbital shaker rotating at 90 rpm, and changed to Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM)/F12-based medium containing 1× glutamax, 1× N2, 1× B27 without vitamin A and 1× antibiotic–antimycotic (anti-anti).
units.rationale: Enriches for H3K27ac‑marked chromatin regions for sequencing.

units.title: Add pA‑Tn5 and incubate for tagmentation
units.text: pA-Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig-med buffer (0.05% digitonin, 20 mM HEPES, pH 7.5, 300 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail) and nuclei were incubated at room temperature for 1 h while rotating.
units.rationale: Tagmentation inserts sequencing adapters into target chromatin.

units.title: Amplify libraries with PCR cycling conditions
units.text: Libraries were amplified with the cycling conditions: 72 °C for 5 min; 98 °C for 30 s; 12 cycles of 98 °C for 10 s and 63 °C for 30 s; final extension at 72 °C for 1 min and hold at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Enriches adapter‑ligated fragments to generate sufficient material for sequencing.

units.title: Prepare nuclei for single‑cell ATAC‑seq using 10X Chromium
units.text: Nuclei were prepared as outlined in the 10X Genomics Chromium single-cell ATAC-seq solution protocol (v1.0 kit was used). Nuclei were loaded with a capture target of 10,000 nuclei per sample.
units.rationale: Enables high‑resolution profiling of chromatin accessibility at the single‑cell level.
